title: Steak Frites with Shallot Butter
description: Classic French-style steak frites: a pan-seared ribeye finished with a garlic-shallot herb butter and served with crisp golden fries. Rich, savory beef and nutty browned butter meld with fresh parsley for an indulgent yet straightforward weeknight or dinner-party main.

ingredients.notes: about 2 steaks (~1 lb each), 1-1.25 inch thick; bring to room temperature
for fries; can be cut into 8mm (1/3 inch) sticks
for shallot butter and finishing (total); cold
for deep or shallow frying fries
plus more for seasoning fries and steaks
toss with cut potatoes before frying

steps.text: Prepare potatoes: peel if desired and cut into uniform fries roughly 8mm thick. Rinse cut potatoes in cold water until water runs clear to remove starch, then dry thoroughly with clean kitchen towels or paper towels.

Par-cook fries (first fry): heat vegetable oil in a heavy-bottomed pot or deep fryer to 320°F (160°C). Fry potatoes in batches without crowding until tender but not colored, about 4-5 minutes per batch. Remove and drain on a wire rack; keep warm. (If using oven method, toss with oil and roast until tender.)

Bring steaks to room temperature and pat dry. Season both sides generously with salt and a light dusting of black pepper. Preheat a heavy skillet (cast-iron preferred) over high heat until smoking slightly.

Sear steaks: add olive oil to the hot pan, then add steaks. Sear without moving for 2-3 minutes until a deep brown crust forms, flip and sear the other side 2-3 minutes. For medium-rare, reduce heat to medium and continue cooking until internal temperature reaches 125-130°F (about 2-4 additional minutes depending on thickness). Adjust for desired doneness.

While steaks rest, make shallot butter: melt two tablespoons of butter in a small skillet over medium heat until foam subsides and butter begins to brown slightly. Add minced shallot and garlic and cook 1-2 minutes until softened and fragrant but not burnt. Remove from heat, stir in remaining cold butter, chopped parsley, thyme leaves, and optional lemon zest. Season with a pinch of salt and let sit to slightly melt into a compound butter.
Rest steaks: transfer steaks to a cutting board and tent loosely with foil; rest 6-8 minutes so juices redistribute. While resting, increase oil temperature for fries to 375°F (190°C).
Crisp fries (second fry): return par-cooked fries to hot oil in batches and fry until golden and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per batch. Remove to a rack or paper towels, immediately season with salt.
Finish and serve: slice steaks against the grain if desired, top with generous dollops of shallot butter to melt. Plate with fries and garnish with extra parsley if desired. Serve immediately.
